author: Bob Mercer
title: Sunset ahead for Michael Pangburn
text:
Leave a reply 
The state Department of Tourism is taking applications through Nov. 13 for director of the South Dakota Arts Council. The post will open in the months ahead as Michael Pangburn retires in February of 2016. He has been director for seven years and joined the councilâ€™s staff in 1998. The council has a board of 11 directors and oversees distribution of grants and services to the arts in South Dakota. Funding comes from the National Endowment for the Arts and state government. Arts funding, by the way, was threatened as state government ran into revenue challenges in 2008. The Legislature in 2009 increased the state tax rate on visitor-related business to 1.5 percent, from the previous 1 percent. This entry was posted in SD Government on
